intro: Pimpinella helosciadoidea, commonly known as the Mexican cowpea, is a herbaceous plant native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is often found in disturbed areas. Its seeds are edible and have been used in traditional cuisines, while its leaves are also consumed as a vegetable. Pimpinella helosciadoidea is valued for its nutritional content and adaptability to various soil conditions.
